intro: Hieracium bupleuroides subsp. cassianum, commonly known as the Cassian's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is a perennial herb that produces seeds through a process called wind pollination.
